Package camzup.core

Class Color

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Color
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<Color>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
public class Color
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Color>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
A mutable, extensible color class. Supports RGBA and HSBA color spaces. Supports conversion to and from integers where color channels are in the format 0xAARRGGBB (Java).

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  Color.AbstrEasing
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of color easing functions.
    static class  Color.ClrIterator
    An iterator, which allows a color's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.
    static class  Color.ComparatorBri
    Compares two colors by brightness.
    static class  Color.ComparatorHsb
    An abstract class to facilitate the creation of HSB comparators.
    static class  Color.ComparatorHue
    Compares two colors by hue.
    static class  Color.ComparatorSat
    Compares two colors by saturation.
    static class  Color.HueCCW
    Eases the hue in the counter-clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueCW
    Eases between hues in the clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueEasing
    An abstract parent class for hue easing functions.
    static class  Color.HueFar
    Eases between hues by the farthest clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.HueNear
    Eases between hues by the nearest clockwise direction.
    static class  Color.LerpRgba
    Eases between two colors.
    static class  Color.MixHsba
    Eases between colors by hue, saturation and brightness.
    static class  Color.SmoothStepRgba
    Eases between two colors with the smooth step formula: t2 ( 3.0 - 2.0 t ) .

    static float luminance​(int c)
    Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .

    Colors stored as integers are less precise than those stored as floats (1.0 / 255.0 being the smallest difference between a channel of two integer colors).

  • Constructor Details

    • Color

      public Color()
      The default constructor. Creates a white color.

    • Color

      public Color​(byte red, byte green, byte blue)
      Creates a color from bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [-128, 127] .
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

      public Color​(float red, float green, float blue)
      Creates a color out of red, green and blue channels. The alpha channel defaults to 1.0 .
      Parameters:

      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

    • Color

      public Color​(java.lang.String rstr, java.lang.String gstr, java.lang.String bstr)
      Attempts to construct a color from Strings using Float.parseFloat(String) . If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero. If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero for red, green and blue; to one for alpha.
      Parameters:
      rstr - the red string
      gstr - the green string
      bstr - the blue string

    • Color

      public Color​(java.lang.String rstr, java.lang.String gstr, java.lang.String bstr, java.lang.String astr)
      Attempts to construct a color from Strings using Float.parseFloat(String) . If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero. If a NumberFormatException is thrown, the component is set to zero for red, green and blue; to one for alpha.
      Parameters:
      rstr - the red string
      gstr - the green string
      bstr - the blue string
      astr - the alpha string

  • Method Details

    • clone

      public Color clone()
      Returns a new color with this color's components. Java's cloneable interface is problematic; use set or a copy constructor instead.
      Returns:
      a new color
      See Also:
      set(Color), Color(Color)

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo​(Color c)
      Returns -1 when this color is less than the comparisand; 1 when it is greater than; 0 when the two are 'equal'. The implementation of this method allows collections of colors to be sorted.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Color>
      Parameters:
      c - the comparisand
      Returns:
      the numeric code

    • dec

      public Color dec()
      Returns a new color decremented by IUtils.ONE_255, 0.003921568859368563f. For interoperability with Kotlin: --a (prefix) or a-- (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the color in place.
      Returns:
      the decremented vector
      See Also:
      sub(Color, float, Color)

    • div

      public Color div​(Color c)
      Returns a new color with the division of the instance by the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a / b . Does not mutate the color in place.
      Parameters:
      c - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient
      See Also:
      div(Color, Color, Color)

      Returns a new color incremented by IUtils.ONE_255, 0.003921568859368563f. For interoperability with Kotlin: ++a (prefix) or a++ (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the color in place.
      Returns:
      the incremented color
      See Also:
      add(Color, float, Color)

    • add

      public static Color add​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Adds the left and right operand, except for the alpha channel, then clamps the sum to [0.0, 1.0] . The left operand's alpha channel is retained. For that reason, color addition is not commutative.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      target - output color
      Returns:
      the sum

    • fromHex

      public static Color fromHex​(java.lang.String c, Color target)
      Attempts to convert a hexadecimal String to a color. Recognized formats include:
      • "abc" - RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "#abc" - hash tag, RGB, one digit per channel.
      • "aabbcc" - RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "#aabbcc" - hash tag, RRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "aabbccdd" - AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      • "0xaabbccdd" - '0x' prefix, AARRGGBB, two digits per channel.
      The output color will be reset if no suitable format is recognized.
      Parameters:
      c - the input String
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      Integer.parseInt(String, int), Long.parseLong(String, int), fromHex(int, Color), String.replaceAll(String, String), String.substring(int)

    • fromKeyword

      public static Color fromKeyword​(java.lang.String keyword, Color target)
      Returns one of the 16 web safe colors from a string key word. See HTML color names.

      Differences in naming conventions include:
      • (0.0, 1.0, 1.0) may be either aqua or cyan;
      • (1.0, 0.0, 1.0) may be either fuchsia or magenta;
      • (0.0, 1.0, 0.0) is lime, not green;
      • (0.0, 0.5, 0.0) is green.
      Parameters:
      keyword - the key word
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color by keyword

    • inverse

      public static Color inverse​(Color c, Color target)
      Inverts a color by subtracting the red, green and blue channels from one. Similar to bitNot, except alpha is not affected. Also similar to adding 0.5 to the x component of a Vec4 storing hue, saturation and brightness.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the inverse

    • luminance

      public static float luminance​(Color c)
      Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the luminance

    • luminance

      public static float luminance​(int c)
      Returns the relative luminance of the color, based on https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Relative_luminance .

      Colors stored as integers are less precise than those stored as floats (1.0 / 255.0 being the smallest difference between a channel of two integer colors). Combined with single precision when multiplying small numbers (all weighting factors must be divided by 255.0 ), this will not yield the same result as luminance(Color) .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      Returns:
      the luminance

    • max

      public static Color max​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Sets the target color to the maximum components of the input colors. The maximums are then clamped to [0.0, 1.0]. Equivalent to a 'lightest' mixing function.
      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the maximum

      Parameters:
      a - the left operand
      b - the right operand
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the maximum

    • quantize

      public static Color quantize​(Color c, int levels, Color target)
      Reduces the signal, or granularity, of a color's channels. Any level less than 2 or greater than 255 returns sets the target to the input.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      levels - the levels
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the posterized color
      See Also:
      Vec4.quantize(Vec4, int, Vec4), Utils.floor(float)

    • random

      public static Color random​(java.util.Random rng, Color target)
      Creates a random color. Defaults to a random RGB channel.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output color
      Returns:
      the color

    • randomHsb

      public static Color randomHsb​(java.util.Random rng, Color target, Vec4 hsba)
      Creates a random HSBA vector, then converts it to an RGBA color. The alpha channel is not randomized.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      target - the output color
      hsba - the output HSBA vector
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:
      hsbaToRgba(Vec4, Color)

    • randomHsb

      public static Color randomHsb​(java.util.Random rng, Vec4 lowerBound, Vec4 upperBound, Color target, Vec4 hsba)
      Creates a random HSBA vector from a lower- and upper-bound, then converts it to an RGBA color. The alpha channel is not included.
      Parameters:
      rng - the random number generator
      lowerBound - the lower bound
      upperBound - the upper bound
      target - the output color
      hsba - the output HSBA vector
      Returns:
      the color
      See Also:

      green - the green channel

      Returns:

    • rgbaToXyzw

      public static Vec4 rgbaToXyzw​(float r, float g, float b, float a, Vec4 target)
      Converts a color from RGB to CIE XYZ. References Pharr, Jakob, and Humphreys' Physically Based Rendering.
      Parameters:
      r - the red component
      g - the green component
      b - the blue component
      a - the alpha component
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the XYZ values.

    • shiftBri

      public static Color shiftBri​(Color c, float shift, Color target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts a color's brightness by a factor. The brightness is clamped to the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      shift - the brightness shift
      target - the output color
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted color

    • shiftHsb

      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      shift - the shift
      target - the output color
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted color

    • shiftHue

      public static Color shiftHue​(Color c, float shift, Color target, Vec4 hsba)
      Shifts a color's hue by a factor. The hue wraps around the range [0.0, 1.0] .
      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      shift - the hue shift
      target - the output color
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted color

      public static Color shiftSat​(Color c, float shift, Color target, Vec4 hsba)

      Parameters:
      c - the input color
      shift - the saturation shift
      target - the output color
      hsba - the color in HSB
      Returns:
      the shifted color

    • sub

      public static Color sub​(Color a, Color b, Color target)
      Subtracts the right operand from the left operand, except for the alpha channel, then clamps the sum to [0.0, 1.0] . The left operand's alpha channel is retained.
      Parameters:
      a - left operand
      b - right operand
      target - output color
      Returns:
      the difference

      Returns:
      the color in hexadecimal

      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string

      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
      See Also:

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.String toHexWeb​(Color c)
      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string

    • toHexWeb

      public static java.lang.String toHexWeb​(int c)
      Returns a web-friendly representation of the color as a hexadecimal code, preceded by a hash tag, '#', with no alpha. Assumes the number will be formatted as 0xAARRGGBB , where alpha is the first channel, followed by red, green and blue.
      Parameters:
      c - the color
      Returns:
      the string
